# Question

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".

```julia
# Function to clean a column name
function clean_column(col)
    return String(strip(Symbol(lowercase(col)))) * "_"
end
```

This function takes a `String` or `SubString{String}` and returns a `String` with the following modifications:

1. It lowercases the column name using `lowercase()`.
2. It strips leading and trailing whitespaces using `strip(::AbstractString)`, which is equivalent to calling `String(strip(::SubString{String}, Whitespace()))` in Julia v1.6+.
3. It appends an underscore (`"_"`) at the end.

Please note that this function does not handle non-ASCII characters or symbols other than hyphens and spaces. If you need to support more complex column names, you may need to extend the functionality of this function accordingly.
